biogHist.p: St. Joseph's College is established under the authority of the Roman Catholic Church. It received affiliation in 1926 and opened its residence on campus in 1927. From 1927 to 1963 it was directed by the Christian Brothers (Brothers of the Christian Schools - FSC); since 1963 the Basilian Fathers (Congregation of St. Basil - CSB) have been its directors. Rectors: 1927-1933 Rogation Boulton[?]; 1933-1939 Memorian Sheehy; 1939-1945 Ansbert Sheehy; 1945-1951 Prudent MacDonald; 1951-1957 Luke Overs; 1957-1959 Aloysius Doiron; 1959-1963 Prudent MacDonald; 1963-1965 J. Wilfred Dore; 1965-1968 Robert M. Montague; 1968-1969 Robert W. Finn; 1969-1978 Joseph B. Courtney. Principals: 1978-1983 Alphonse A.M. de Valk; 1983-1984 P. Wallace Platt. Presidents: 1984-1990 P. Wallace Platt; 1990- Robert Barringer.
